name: US Rep Rodney Davis
tweet_text: She lives and our family lives with her pre-existing condition coverage every day. Let's stop playing politics with health care. Let's work together to make sure that all Americans have access to care and are able to get the coverage they need.

name: US Rep Rodney Davis
tweet_text: What's frustrating to me is that sometimes I hear my colleagues on the other side of the aisle talk about how this side of the aisle wants to get rid of pre-existing condition coverage. Every time I hear that, it hurts because I've seen what my wife went through.

name: US Rep Rodney Davis
tweet_text: But because of the great American medical system and the research that was done at places like the NIH for years before my wife was diagnosed, she was able to get the surgery and treatment she needed to now celebrate this anniversary.

name: US Rep Rodney Davis
tweet_text: It's a day that we will all remember, a day of success much different than the day of her diagnosis just a little over six months before that. We were a young couple with a 2-year-old daughter and didn't know what the future held...

name: US Rep Rodney Davis
tweet_text: Today is the 21st anniversary of my wife Shannon's last chemotherapy treatment after she was diagnosed and treated for colon cancer in 1999. Shannon - you are so courageous and the kids and I are so proud of you. https://t.co/PtjvsdUfUD

name: US Rep Rodney Davis

name: US Rep Rodney Davis
tweet_text: It‚Äôs time for Democrats like Sen. Durbin to keep politics out of the post office. We need to give our letter carriers, local post masters, and other USPS employees the resources they need to do their jobs. They shouldn‚Äôt be pawns in the Democrats‚Äô partisan games.

name: US Rep Rodney Davis
tweet_text: And I‚Äôd just like to note - I have been in Congress since 2013. @SenatorDurbin has been in Congress since 1983. What accomplishments from his 37 years in office can he point to that have addressed the long-term solvency problems of the @USPS?

name: US Rep Rodney Davis
tweet_text: Finally ‚Äì I have long been an opponent of USPS privatization. I strongly believe that USPS should remain an entity of the US Government, which the Constitution empowers Congress to do.

tweet_text: I‚Äôve also supported legislation to maintain 6-day delivery, door delivery for residences and businesses, and maintain 2012 service standards, not just in the 116th Congress, but in past Congresses as well. Learn more about those bills here: https://t.co/9R8Srh8gw6

name: US Rep Rodney Davis
tweet_text: It‚Äôs time for government to update our laws in order to protect a free and open internet.

name: US Rep Rodney Davis
tweet_text: Regulating the internet under this antiquated 1930s law has prohibited small internet companies from making investments in rural areas, which runs counter to the rural broadband investments I continue to push for.

name: US Rep Rodney Davis
tweet_text:
That's why I‚Äôm supporting three bills that allow the @FTC to ensure true net neutrality by: 

‚úÖProhibiting blocking, throttling, and paid prioritization for internet trafficking 
‚úÖ Creating more transparency from internet service providers.

name: US Rep Rodney Davis
tweet_text: Regulating the internet under a law that was written to regulate telephones that had dials and party lines is not the way we protect net neutrality.

tweet_text: As the reauthorization process moves forward, it is essential that we find ways to build more efficiently ‚Äì to stretch the Federal dollar. We need to identify & attack hidden project costs by streamlining the project delivery process & reducing burdensome regulations.

tweet_text: Not only is adequate infrastructure investment important to mobility, it also creates jobs and allows our economy to prosper.

name: US Rep Rodney Davis
tweet_text: Our current surface transportation system has significant needs & it will only get worse as we look to plan for the future. Underinvestment has taken its toll on the system‚Äôs ability to move people and freight ‚Äì we face increasing congestion, delays, & safety issues.

name: US Rep Rodney Davis
tweet_text: The Highway Trust Fund is not able to meet our surface transportation needs as they stand today, let alone our future needs. Congress & the Administration must come together & find a way to shore-up the HTF, providing sustainable funding for our surface transportation programs.

name: US Rep Rodney Davis
tweet_text: The surface transportation reauthorization bill will allow the Federal government to continue its long-standing role in infrastructure investment. But we have some big challenges and opportunities before us.

name: US Rep Rodney Davis
tweet_text: This being our first hearing on reauthorization, it is important to note how critical this bill is to ensuring a good quality of life for all Americans and to support the U.S. economy.

name: US Rep Rodney Davis
tweet_text: The FAST Act, which provided $281 billion for federal surface transportation programs, expires on September 30, 2020. @EleanorNorton @RepPeterDeFazio @RepSamGraves and I will work together to develop a long-term, bipartisan bill to reauthorize surface transporation programs.
